comment: I have mixed feelings about this prof. She's nice ig but can also be a LOT. Lots of weekly reading and tons of busy work that isn't beneficial at all. She's accessible outside of class but not always helpful with her answers. Almost everything we did felt pointless/like busy work. For an online class, it was quite time consuming. Big workload.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: This was my favorite professor throughout the entire program, HANDS DOWN! Honestly, If you do your reading and take a couple notes (they're graded for completion not accuracy) and show up to class. That's the bulk of your grade right there. If you can, I recommend taking her for both 3320 and 3330. You won't regret it.

This professor provides clear guidelines, engaging activities, and valuable instruction. Completing readings and attending class ensures easy points. Sanders ends each session with a book, seen by some as "patronizing," but it's a delightful way to conclude class and suggest useful children's books. Office hours are available for additional help.

She is nice but she makes the class disengaging by standing up and talking the WHOLE time (and reading books to us like we are children and making us do activities like we are children) with one 20-30 minute break. Tough grader- make sure you follow her rubric. I wish she taught us more about how to teach Reading, Writing, and Grammar to K-5 kids.

She taught the content similarly to how we would be teaching it to our students. You will be expected to read weekly and take notes on the reading for a grade, and there is a participation grade for each class. However, the work itself is very easy and she is willing to be a little bit flexible if you have things going on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Sanders was an amazing professor. She was so sweet and understanding and made sure nobody was ever overwhelmed or confused on anything.

Mrs. Sanders is sweet! She does read off the slides and read books to us like kids during lectures. I think she really taught us a lot and prepared us for the classroom setting. Field Experience was a lot but she was there to help guide us and answer our questions along the way. Show up, do the work, and you'll get an A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I absolutely loved Dr. Sanders! Her class was not at all overwhelming. Several classmates complained about her all the time but to be honest, they had NOTHING to complain about! Seriously! She was sweet & fair! Due dates were spaced out and each assignment was genuinely manageable. I'm a single mom and was able to easily handle this class. Easy A!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Not ever again! My friend had COVID and was in the hospital for a few days. Professor Sanders did not give her attendance points. All she does is read through powerpoints and assigns so many projects.

The field experience component portion of this class is A LOT! Be prepared to work hard! She gives mediocre feedback but is willing to extend deadlines. Her class is long and unengaging. Be prepared for her to read story books as if you are a child.
I love professor Sanders! She is very helpful and always willing to go the extra step. She makes her class interesting and engaging. Her grading criteria is clear and easy to follow.
Very nice professor! She is knowledgeable and helpful. She loves teaching, and it shows! She brings in books and items she uses in her own classroom. She makes the class fun. I would take her again!

She is an excellent professor.  She explains things very well and will answer any questions you have about anything.  She loves to share her experiences she has had with everyone so you can get a better understanding of things.  Highly recommend.
